author: @rockytoptech1308
text: Man I've been thinking about putting a Raspberry Pi or maybe the NVIDIA Jetson in my side by side... Great job man...looks good! I'd use mounts though instead of Velcro and stuff...I mean unless you drive like me ya should be fine but lol I am going to use mounts.   Oh lastly I wouldn't wire the device to the overhead light or an accessory power supply as they're not meant to be hot (12v+) constantly, the switch would be relatively safe but I wouldn't trust 12v+ coming off of any switch constantly. Personally I'm going to use an online 10a fuse and switch and relay to be safe and secure :-)  Also, I absolutely love your cheap mindset....I'm the same. I considered actually just putting in an old lappy running Ubuntu but that's kinda bulky.

author: @goodgoat6019
text: The keyboard is either silicone rubber or EPDM. 3M makes an adhesive (9731) that has a .0015 thick polyester carrier, a normal acrylic adhesive that adheres to most surfaces on one side, and a special adhesive that sticks to silicone only on the opposite side. It's very expensive.
